intro: Meoschium elatum, commonly known as the tall meadow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters at the ends of its stems. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Meoschium elatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
